I know colliders have to be convex, so please make the decoupler models non-hollow so you wouldn't -think- this works (a decoupler added to a fuel-tank, with a girder sticking out the back through the (presumably) hollow decoupler).

This blows up because the collider is just a pancake... Very counter intuitive at first... Either change the collider mesh (not possible because of convexity?) or the model...

Edited November 30, 2015 by Chris_2
